item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Joan Crawford
item.description: "Love is a fire. But whether it is going to warm your hearth or burn down your house, you can never tell." -- Joan Crawford

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Jeffrey McDaniel
item.description: "Even when I'm dead, I'll swim through the Earth, like a mermaid of the soil, just to be next to your bones." -- Jeffrey McDaniel

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you simply, without problems or pride: I love you in this way because I do not know any other way of loving but this, in which there is no I or you, so intimate that your hand upon my chest is my hand, so intimate that when I fall asleep your eyes close." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "If one wanted to depict the whole thing graphically, every episode, with its climax, would require a three-dimensional, or, rather, no model: every experience is unrepeatable. What makes lovemaking and reading resemble each other most is that within both of them times and spaces open, different from measurable time and space." -- Italo Calvino

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "A half-read book is a half-finished love affair." -- David Mitchell

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "And it came to me then. That we were wonderful traveling companions but in the end no more than lonely lumps of metal in their own separate orbits. From far off they look like beautiful shooting stars, but in reality they're nothing more than prisons, where each of us is locked up alone, going nowhere. When the orbits of these two satellites of ours happened to cross paths, we could be together. Maybe even open our hearts to each other. But that was only for the briefest moment. In the next instant we'd be in absolute solitude. Until we burned up and became nothing." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "It was a love of perpetual flight." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "It is good to love many things, for therein lies the true strength, and whosoever loves much performs much, and can accomplish much, and what is done in love is well done." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Paul Auster
item.description: "I had jumped off the edge, and then, at the very last moment, something reached out and caught me in midair. That something is what I define as love. It is the one thing that can stop a man from falling, powerful enough to negate the laws of gravity." -- Paul Auster

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Love is an irresistible desire to be irresistibly desired." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Love can change a person the way a parent can change a baby- awkwardly, and often with a great deal of mess." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "For one human being to love another human being: that is perhaps the most difficult task that has been given to us, the ultimate, the final problem and proof, the work for which all other work is merely preparation." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Murakami, Haruki
item.description: "Anyone who falls in love is searching for the missing pieces of themselves. So anyone who's in love gets sad when they think of their lover. It's like stepping back inside a room you have fond memories of, one you haven't seen in a long time." -- Murakami, Haruki

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Irish Curse
item.description: "May those who love us love us.And those that don't love us,May God turn their hearts.And if He doesn't turn their hearts,May he turn their ankles,So we'll know them by their limping." -- Irish Curse

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "Capacity for love in its higher forms seems to be peculiarly human although even in humans it is still peculiar." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Robert Fulghum
item.description: "We’re all a little weird. And life is a little weird. And when we find someone whose weirdness is compatible with ours, we join up with them and fall into mutually satisfying weirdness—and call it love—true love." -- Robert Fulghum

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I love you also means I love you more than anyone loves you, or has loved you, or will love you, and also, I love you in a way that no one loves you, or has loved you, or will love you, and also, I love you in a way that I love no one else, and never have loved anyone else, and never will love anyone else." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I was nauseous and tingly all over. I was either in love or I had smallpox." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Photons have mass? I didn’t even know they were Catholic." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Basically my wife was immature. I'd be at home in my bath and she'd come in and sink my boats." -- Woody Allen
